meanings.definition: A woman who directs or manages
meanings.sent1: The directress of the play guided the actors during rehearsals.
meanings.sent2: The school directress oversees the daily operations of the institution.
meanings.sent3: The directress of the garden made sure the flowers were all facing the sun.
meanings.sent4: She was the directress of her own destiny, shaping her future with each decision.
meanings.sent5: The directress of the orchestra waved her baton, signaling the musicians to begin.

meanings.sent1: The directress of the company made important decisions for the team.
meanings.sent2: The directress of the meeting ensured that everyone had a chance to speak.
meanings.sent3: The directress of the office always had a smile on her face, brightening up the workplace.
meanings.sent4: She was the directress of the group, guiding them towards success with her leadership.
meanings.sent5: The directress of the project inspired her team to work hard towards their goals.
